contentrichtext.text: '''Ursus''' is [[Latin language|Latin]] for "[[bear]]". In this form it refers to a male bear or the species regardless of gender; the specifically female form is [[Ursa (disambiguation)|Ursa]]. The word may also refer to: * [[Ursus (praefectus urbi)]], ''praefectus urbi'' of Constantinople in 415-416 * [[Ursus (genus)]], a genus of bears * [[Ursus (beer)]], a Romanian beer * [[Ursus (vodka)]], an Icelandic vodka * [[Ursus, Warsaw]], a borough of Warsaw, Poland * [[Ursus Tractor Factory]], Poland * [[Saint Ursus (disambiguation)]], the name of several Christian saints * [[Reimarus Ursus]] (16th-century), an astronomer and imperial mathematician to Rudolf II * [[Ursus (film character)]], a fictional character in Italian adventure films * [[General Ursus (Planet of the Apes)]], a gorilla character in ''Beneath the Planet of the Apes'' * Ursus, the bodyguard of Ligia, a minor character in [[Quo Vadis (novel)|''Quo Vadis'' (novel)]] * Ursus, a character in Victor Hugo's novel ''[[The Man Who Laughs]]'' * [[Ursus (film)|''Ursus'' (film)]], 1961 Italian film ==See also== * [[Ursa (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
